intro: Pavetta acrochlora, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue or black berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Pavetta acrochlora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
